description:

subtitles: to store cilantro in the refrigerator use kitchen shears to trim about one inch off of the bottom of the stems then fill a glass jar nearly halfway with cool water place the cilantro into the jar making sure only the stems are submerged loosely cover the leaves with a plastic bag to keep in my stir you can also secure the bag to the jar with a rubber band store the cilantro in the refrigerator for up to two weeks replacing the water every two to three daysto store cilantro in the refrigerator use kitchen shears to trim about one inch off of the bottom of the stems then fill a glass jar nearly halfway with cool water place the cilantro into the jar making sure only the stems are submerged loosely cover the leaves with a plastic bag to keep in my stir you can also secure the bag to the jar with a rubber band store the cilantro in the refrigerator for up to two weeks replacing the water every two to three days

title: How to Taste Wine | wikiHow Asks a Certified Wine Consultant
description:
Learn more about how to taste wine and develop your palate from certified wine consultant, Murphy Perng. Read more in this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Taste-Wine

---
Murphy Perng is a Wine Consultant and the Founder and Host of Matter of Wine, a business that produces educational wine events, including team-building experiences and networking events. Based in Los Angeles, California, Murphy has collaborated with brands such as Equinox, Buzzfeed, WeWork, and Stage & Table, to name a few. Murphy possesses her WSET (Wine & Spirit Education Trust) Level 3 Advanced Certification.
Learn more: https://matterofwine.com/

---

title: How to Tell if a Pineapple Is Ripe
description:
Learn How to Tell if a Pineapple Is Ripe with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Tell-if-a-Pineapple-Is-Ripe

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to tell if a pineapple is ripe first look at the color of its rind the more yellow the rind is the riper the pineapple will be a pineapple that's a golden yellow color from top to bottom is perfect if the rind is green the pineapple isn't ripe enough but if it's dark orange the pineapple is too ripe you can also tell if a pineapple is ripe by squeezing it if the rind feels slightly soft its ripe but if it's tough and solid the pineapple isn't ripe enough yet finally try smelling the bottom of the pineapple to see how ripe it is if it smells fruity and sweet it's probably ripe but if it smells like vinegar the pineapple is likely overripeto tell if a pineapple is ripe first look at the color of its rind the more yellow the rind is the riper the pineapple will be a pineapple that's a golden yellow color from top to bottom is perfect if the rind is green the pineapple isn't ripe enough but if it's dark orange the pineapple is too ripe you can also tell if a pineapple is ripe by squeezing it if the rind feels slightly soft its ripe but if it's tough and solid the pineapple isn't ripe enough yet finally try smelling the bottom of the pineapple to see how ripe it is if it smells fruity and sweet it's probably ripe but if it smells like vinegar the pineapple is likely overripe

title: How to Temper Chocolate
description:
One cannot simply melt chocolate and then expect it to return to its original glossy, firm state! For chocolate to return to this state it has to be heated and cooled to allow a certain type of crystal (crystal V) to develop. This heating and cooling process is called tempering and it can be done in a number of different ways.

This quick video will give you some tips on how to give your chocolate creations the perfect shine and snap!

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Temper-Chocolate

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: if you want to temper chocolate first fill a large bowl with ice water then place about 2/3 of your chocolate into a second dry bowl heat the bowl of chocolate on top of a pot of water that's simmering but not boiling until the chocolate reaches 110 degrees Fahrenheit 43 degrees Celsius then place the bowl of melted chocolate inside of the bowl of ice water stir the chocolate slowly but constantly until the chocolate cools to 95 degrees Fahrenheit 35 degrees Celsius remove the bowl from the ice water and add the remaining third of your chocolate stir until the chocolate is well combined and smoothif you want to temper chocolate first fill a large bowl with ice water then place about 2/3 of your chocolate into a second dry bowl heat the bowl of chocolate on top of a pot of water that's simmering but not boiling until the chocolate reaches 110 degrees Fahrenheit 43 degrees Celsius then place the bowl of melted chocolate inside of the bowl of ice water stir the chocolate slowly but constantly until the chocolate cools to 95 degrees Fahrenheit 35 degrees Celsius remove the bowl from the ice water and add the remaining third of your chocolate stir until the chocolate is well combined and smooth

title: How to Properly Quick Thaw Frozen Fish
description:
Having frozen fish on hand is a great way to enjoy delicious, healthful lean protein whenever you want. Australis Barramundi is packaged to thaw beautifully and safely, giving you a great piece of fish to work with. 

Key Takeaways 
+ Start with the fish solidly frozen. Don't pre-thaw in the fridge.
+ Don't remove the vacuum-packaging before thawing. Thawing fish "naked" under water makes it waterlogged.
+ Use only cold tap water to thaw as this minimizes the risk of bacterial growth. 
+ Remove packaging as soon as it's thawed and use the thawed fish immediately to ensure best results!

Planning to thaw the fish in your refrigerator overnight? Make sure to remove the vacuum-packaging BEFORE you let it thaw and place the fillets on a paper towel-lined plate. 

Where to Buy Australis Barramundi
http://better.fish/storelocator

subtitles: if you want to thicken soup you can add a creamy element like cream yogurt or coconut milk to the soup then simmer the soup gently for about 10 minutes if you'd rather use starch to thicken your soup you can add chunks of bread to your soup and simmer it until the bread dissolves or you can make a slurry out of cool water and cornstarch then add it to the soup and simmer for an extra 10 minutes if you're making a potato soup or a chowder try adding instant potato flakes to thicken your soupif you want to thicken soup you can add a creamy element like cream yogurt or coconut milk to the soup then simmer the soup gently for about 10 minutes if you'd rather use starch to thicken your soup you can add chunks of bread to your soup and simmer it until the bread dissolves or you can make a slurry out of cool water and cornstarch then add it to the soup and simmer for an extra 10 minutes if you're making a potato soup or a chowder try adding instant potato flakes to thicken your soup

title: How to Treat Apple Cider Vinegar Burns
description:
Learn how to treat apple cider vinegar burns with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-Apple-Cider-Vinegar-Burns

subtitles: apple cider vinegar is used in a variety of home remedies but it can cause burns if you apply it to your skin undiluted for prolonged periods of time to treat an apple cider vinegar burn first rinse the area with cool water for 20 minutes to soothe your skin and flush away any remaining vinegar then apply aloe vera gel to the burn and loosely cover the area with sterilized gauze watch for signs of infection while your burn is healing like redness pus swelling or your skin feeling hot to the touch talk to a doctor if you think your burn is infectedapple cider vinegar is used in a variety of home remedies but it can cause burns if you apply it to your skin undiluted for prolonged periods of time to treat an apple cider vinegar burn first rinse the area with cool water for 20 minutes to soothe your skin and flush away any remaining vinegar then apply aloe vera gel to the burn and loosely cover the area with sterilized gauze watch for signs of infection while your burn is healing like redness pus swelling or your skin feeling hot to the touch talk to a doctor if you think your burn is infected

subtitles: to wash dishes by hand start by scraping any leftover food into the trash then place the empty dishes in the sink and fill the sink with hot water and dish soap next use a sponge or dish cloth to scrub the dishes underwater working on one dish at a time when you're finished scrubbing a dish double check it for any stuck on food before rinsing it off with clean hot water finally let your clean dishes air dry on a drying rack or a clean towelto wash dishes by hand start by scraping any leftover food into the trash then place the empty dishes in the sink and fill the sink with hot water and dish soap next use a sponge or dish cloth to scrub the dishes underwater working on one dish at a time when you're finished scrubbing a dish double check it for any stuck on food before rinsing it off with clean hot water finally let your clean dishes air dry on a drying rack or a clean towel

title: Cleaning Vegetables and Fruits With Lemon Essential Oil
description: http://www.essential-natural-remedies.com/green-household-products.html --How you can use lemon essential oil to clean vegetables and fruit. Great for cleaning vegetables like broccoli and cauliflower. Clean fruit like strawberries, blackberries and grapes
subtitles: I would like to show you how you can use lemon essential oil to clean fruits and vegetables once you have done taking off your fruit and done your initial rinse of the fruit filled the bowl back up with water lean water and drop in about two to three drops of lemon essential oil lemon oil is known to be able to dissolve petrochemicals so it is phenomenal to be able to use it with fruits and vegetables to get off pesticides and herbicides that color the fruit blend it in a bit with the water lemon essential oil tends to float on the water so you need to agitate it and let it sit for a few minutes give it one more rinse and you have wonderful fresh tasting vegetables and fruitI would like to show you how you can use lemon essential oil to clean fruits and vegetables once you have done taking off your fruit and done your initial rinse of the fruit filled the bowl back up with water lean water and drop in about two to three drops of lemon essential oil lemon oil is known to be able to dissolve petrochemicals so it is phenomenal to be able to use it with fruits and vegetables to get off pesticides and herbicides that color the fruit blend it in a bit with the water lemon essential oil tends to float on the water so you need to agitate it and let it sit for a few minutes give it one more rinse and you have wonderful fresh tasting vegetables and fruit

subtitles: to zest a lime start by washing it with cool water then hold a grater above the cutting board so it's at a 45-degree angle and gently drag the lime across it go from the top of the grater to the bottom rotate the lime after each stroke before dragging it across the grater again once you've graded off all of the green peel scrape the pile of zest on the cutting board into a bowl and add it to your recipeto zest a lime start by washing it with cool water then hold a grater above the cutting board so it's at a 45-degree angle and gently drag the lime across it go from the top of the grater to the bottom rotate the lime after each stroke before dragging it across the grater again once you've graded off all of the green peel scrape the pile of zest on the cutting board into a bowl and add it to your recipe
